title: Engineering Intern
description: Contributed to a cybersecurity project focusing on Operating System hardening and configuration management.
Spearheaded rigorous OS hardening tests using CIS tools, resulting in improved system security and elevated CIS score by 21%.
Developed tailored manifest files for LAMP configurations using shell scripting, ensuring consistent environment setups.
Orchestrated VM creation and image deployment (VMDK/OVF) utilising VMware EXSi.

title: Software Engineer
description: Engineered and modeled Java connectors facilitating data operations between enterprise systems and EQ’s business intelligence and migration products.
Executed Maven-based cross-platform integration performing CRUD functionalities in SQL and NoSQL database connectors using an extended JDBC framework.
Created microservices for a graph database’s Next-Gen connector, resulting in a 27% performance boost verified by QA.
Incorporated efficient Object-Oriented Programming principles and Java features to implement diverse functionalities complemented by rigorous unit testing using JUnit5 framework.
Enhanced code quality through SonarQube-compliant refactoring and reformatting, boosting maintainability and efficiency.
Well-versed with test-driven development, version control system, customer interaction and troubleshooting and Jenkins.
Led and mentored a team of 2 junior colleagues, demonstrating effective leadership and management skills.

title: Intern
description: • Built a web application, applying various JAVA design patterns to architect the system, utilizing servlets for dynamic web support, and JDBC for backend connectivity.
Wrote more than 50 test cases for modules and performed unit testing of the system as a part of QA team.
